items.title: TIL: Use VS Code as diff tool
items.summary: You can use Visual Studio Code as a diff tool.

items.title: TIL: How to create a simple histogram to see a trend in data
items.summary: You can use SQL for generating simple histograms.
items.content_text: How many unique users were created each monthSELECT EXTRACT(YEAR FROM created_at) as year,       EXTRACT(MONTH FROM created_at) as month,       COUNT(DISTINCT(email)),       LPAD('', (COUNT(DISTINCT(email))/100)::int, '#') as frequencyFROM usersGROUP BY 1,2; year | month | count | frequency------+-------+-------+----------- 2016 |     1 |   500 | 2016 |     2 |  1000 | # 2016 |     3 |  1100 | # 2016 |     4 |  1200 | # 2016 |     5 |  2000 | ## 2016 |     6 |  3000 | ### 2016 |     7 |  2000 | ## 2016 |     8 |  2000 | ## 2016 |     9 |  5000 | ##### 2016 |    10 |  5500 | ##### 2016 |    11 |  5000 | ##### 2016 |    12 |  1000 | #
items.content_html:
How many unique users were created each month

SELECT EXTRACT(YEAR FROM created_at) as year,       EXTRACT(MONTH FROM created_at) as month,       COUNT(DISTINCT(email)),       LPAD('', (COUNT(DISTINCT(email))/100)::int, '#') as frequencyFROM usersGROUP BY 1,2;
 year | month | count | frequency------+-------+-------+----------- 2016 |     1 |   500 | 2016 |     2 |  1000 | # 2016 |     3 |  1100 | # 2016 |     4 |  1200 | # 2016 |     5 |  2000 | ## 2016 |     6 |  3000 | ### 2016 |     7 |  2000 | ## 2016 |     8 |  2000 | ## 2016 |     9 |  5000 | ##### 2016 |    10 |  5500 | ##### 2016 |    11 |  5000 | ##### 2016 |    12 |  1000 | #

items.title: TIL: How to handle if image didnâ€™t load
items.summary: You can use SQL for generating simple histograms.
items.content_text: Sometimes you can have a problem with images, especially when urls for them isgenerated in the code. Like for Gravatar service. User has an email, but shedoesnâ€™t use Gravatar service. You donâ€™t want to make an additional call tocheck if image is there or handle that on the server. You only want to makeone call and if the image doesnâ€™t exist or it canâ€™t be loaded, a placeholderimage should be displayed or the empty image should be hidden altogether.Html tag <img/> has two event methods onLoad and onError, which could be usedfor this case.JS Bin - example<img  onerror="onError(event.currentTarget.currentSrc)"  src="http://image.isnt.there/img.png"/><img  onload="onLoad(event.currentTarget.currentSrc)"  src="https://en.gravatar.com/userimage/9268958/419f96d0498ad49530ad44c268085142.png"/>function onLoad(src) {  console.log("Image was loaded " + src);}function onError(src) {  console.log("Image doesn't load " + src);}Yes, I know Gravatar provides default image if image for an email doesnâ€™t exist.But sometimes that isnâ€™t enough.Gravatar - Image Requests
items.content_html:
Sometimes you can have a problem with images, especially when urls for them isgenerated in the code. Like for Gravatar service. User has an email, but shedoesnâ€™t use Gravatar service. You donâ€™t want to make an additional call tocheck if image is there or handle that on the server. You only want to makeone call and if the image doesnâ€™t exist or it canâ€™t be loaded, a placeholderimage should be displayed or the empty image should be hidden altogether.

Html tag <img/> has two event methods onLoad and onError, which could be usedfor this case.

JS Bin - example

<img  onerror="onError(event.currentTarget.currentSrc)"  src="http://image.isnt.there/img.png"/><img  onload="onLoad(event.currentTarget.currentSrc)"  src="https://en.gravatar.com/userimage/9268958/419f96d0498ad49530ad44c268085142.png"/>
function onLoad(src) {  console.log("Image was loaded " + src);}function onError(src) {  console.log("Image doesn't load " + src);}

Yes, I know Gravatar provides default image if image for an email doesnâ€™t exist.But sometimes that isnâ€™t enough.

Gravatar - Image Requests
